description: A wonderful social game. Also, the art is superb.

Good for newbies, it gets a good convo going after each round regarding why someone said a clue and why others chose their card. Simple rules, expansive feel if you have a creative mind. Enjoyable watching people who know each other well being able to figure out what the clue may be refering to.
It’s like a better Apple’s to a Apple’s

title: Good game,...
description: Good game, I didn't play this recently, but I use its card for Mysterium. I'm willing to play, not less than 4, not more than 6 players (we played this in a group of 10, not recommend it more than 6 players)

title: Cards Agai...
description: Cards Against Humanity, without the dick jokes, and with beautiful art. Requires a little more brain power than the aforementioned.

title: Got bored ...
description: Got bored with this. Maybe I just need to play with a new or expanded group. Kids love it though, and I'll play to keep them happy.

title: A party ga...
description: A party game that's engaging even for dull gamers like me! I'm generally not too keen on party games, but this one is not sophomoric in subject matter. I like ones that allow for clever and interesting story or dialogue.

title: 'twas an e...
description: 'twas an enjoyable party type game with real gamer mechanics.  So it still exists solely in the gamer realm, though with easy to teach rules, and creative gameplay. I'll play it, I enjoy it while I'm playing it, but I'm not looking for it in particular, and I have plenty of games that fill this need for me I'd rather play.

title: Nice fille...
description: Nice filler, although the guessing riddles tend often to be too short.

title: One of our...
description: One of our well-played titles. This is a family favorite and go to game for teaching muggles.
